Information Technology “ Chinese Character Encoding Character Set
1. This standard defines the hexadecimal representation of the graphical Chinese characters and their binary codes used in information technology.
This standard applies to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output of Chinese and other text graphics character information.

This standard is applicable to technical products that have the function of information processing and exchange of Chinese and other text graphics and characters, including but not limited to software products represented by input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, speech synthesis, text conversion, and braille writing, as well as portable products represented by computers, communication terminal equipment, electronic books, and learning machines.
2 normative reference documents
The following documents are referred to in the text and are essential to the standard.

Among them, the referenced documents with a date are only applicable to the version corresponding to that date; the referenced documents without a date, the latest edition (including all amendments) is applicable to this document.
GB2312-1980 "Information Exchange Using Chinese Character Encoding Character Set" Basic Set
GB11383-1989 Information Processing "Information Exchange Coding Structure and Encoding Rules
GB13000 Information technology—Universal multiple-byte coded character set (UCS)
3. Terms and definitions
The following terms and definitions apply to this document.
3.1 Character character
One element of the set of elements used for organization, control, or representation of data.
3.2 Encoded Character
A character (3.1) and its encoding.
3.3 Private Use Area
Users of products that conform to this standard may define their own private use areas.
3.4. Repertoire
A set of characters specified by a set of coded characters (3.2) .
3.5 Reserved Zone [
Reserved for future use as defined in this document.
4. Vocabulary
4.1 Overview
The characters collected in this document are encoded in single bytes, double bytes, or quad bytes.
The single-byte part contains all the 128 characters of GB11383-1989 0x00~0x7F.
4.3. Double-byte part
The double-byte part contains all the graphic characters in GB2312-1980, all the CJK unified Chinese characters in GB13000, and some graphic characters.
The characters in the double-byte part are arranged according to the rules in Appendix A.
Among them, the graphic, code position and function of the semantic character descriptor should conform to the provisions of Appendix B.
Note: GB13000 is a uniform encoding for Chinese characters used in China, Japan, Korea, Vietnam, etc.

The Chinese characters with unique abstract character forms are assigned with unique code positions, while the Chinese characters with the same abstract character forms but different origins are assigned with shared code positions.
The Han Ideographs encoded are called CCJK Unified Ideographs, where CCJK represents China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4. Four-byte part

The four-byte part contains 66 CJK Unified Ideographs in GB13000, CJK Unified Ideographs Extended A, CJK Unified Ideographs Extended BCJK Unified Ideographs Extended C, CJK Unified Ideographs Extended DCJK Unified Ideographs Extended F, and the characters of minority languages that have already been encoded in GB
The characters in the four-byte part are defined according to the rules in Appendix C.
5 Overall Structure
In the text, any number preceded by 0x represents hexadecimal, and any number not preceded by 0x represents decimal.
All the encoded representations in the annex are in hexadecimal, while all other numbers are in decimal.
The single-byte part uses the encoding structure of GB11383-1989, and uses the code bits of 0x00~0x7F.
The double-byte part uses two eight-bit binary digits to represent a character, and the first byte code bit starts from 0x81 to 0xFE, and the last byte code bit is 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
The four-byte part adopts GB11383-1989 without using 0x30 to 0x39 as a suffix for double-byte encoding extension, and the encoding range is 0x81308130 to 0xFE39FE39.

The first byte of a four-byte character is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the second byte is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39; the third byte is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the fourth byte is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39. That is: 0x81308130
The overall structure and bit range allocation are shown in Fig. 1 and Table 1.
The arrangement order of 6 characters
6.1. Order of the single-character brush part characters
The characters of the single-byte code part are arranged in order according to the corresponding characters in GB11383-1989.
6.2. Order of the characters in the double-byte code unit
The order of the sub-characters of the double-character should conform to Appendix A.
6.3. Sorting order of characters in a quad character

The 50400 code bits from 0x81308130 to 0x8439FE39 correspond to all the characters on the basic multilingual plane of GB13000 that are not included in the double-byte part, and are arranged in the order of the corresponding characters on the basic multilingual plane of GB13000.

From 0x90308130 to 0xE339FE39, a total of 1058400 code points are used to correspond to the 16 supplementary planes of GB13000, and the character arrangement order is completely arranged according to the code point order of the corresponding supplementary planes of GB13000.
The order of the characters in the 4-byte part should conform to Appendix C.

8. Description of Parts of Characters and Codes
Compared to GB 18030-2005, the characters and/or the corresponding GBI 13000 codes in some code positions have been adjusted (see Appendix D).
9.1. In general
This document defines three levels of implementation.
The system software product that meets the corresponding implementation level shall provide the input/output function of all characters within the corresponding implementation level range.
9.2 Implementation Level 1

The CJK Unified Han Character (i.e., 0x82358F33 to 0x82359636) and CJK Unified Han Character Extended A (i.e., 0x8139EE39 to 0x82358738) in the single-byte encoded part, the double-byte encoded part, and the four-byte encoded part of this
Any product to which this document applies must meet the requirements of Level 1.
Note: In accordance with the needs of software application, the level 1 implementation can also choose any one or more of the non-Chinese character writing styles listed in Table 3.
9.3 Implementation Level 2
Level 2 of implementation includes Level 1 of implementation.
In addition, the encoding characters that are not included in the Unified Hanzi Standard Table in the Common Standard Hanzi Table are also included in the implementation level 2.
The Chinese characters included in the GB19000-2012 Standard Chinese Character Table and their code positions and forms are shown in the appendix.
The system software and support software should meet the requirements of level 2.
Note: System software and support software include but are not limited to operating systems, database management systems, middleware (information on software product classification see GB36475).
9.4 Implementation Level 3
Level 3 includes Level 2.
In addition, the level 3 implementation also includes all the Chinese characters and the Kang black part of the table 3 as specified in the document.
Products used for government services and public services should meet the requirements of level 3.

Note: The public service and shared service industries include but are not limited to railway transport, road transport, water transport, air transport, intermodal transport and transport agency, postal services, currency and financial services, insurance, land, management, health, national institutions, social security, etc. (Information on industry classification can be found in GB4754)

The C and C++ compilers are integrated.  They both need to process one or more of the steps in the four-step process of handling input files: preprocessing, compilation, assembly, and linking.
The suffix on the source file name identifies the language of the source file, but to the compiler, the suffix controls the default:
gcc considers the preprocessed files (.i) to be C files and sets up linking in C form,
g++ considers preprocessed files (.i) to be C++ files and sets up C++ style linking.
The suffix of the source file name indicates the language type and the later operation:
.c C source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.c C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.cc C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.cxx C++ source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.m Objective-C source program; preprocessing, compilation, linking
.i preprocessed c files; compile, link
.ii preprocessed c++ files; compile, link
.s Assembly language source; assemble
assembly language source; preprocess, assemble
.h Preprocessor files; usually other files with lower names are not transmitted to the linker (Linker) in the command line. Usually include:
.0 Object file
.a archive file
Unless the -cec, -s, or -E options (or a compile error) have been used, linking is always the final step.

During linking, all files that correspond to the source program, .e files, -1 library files, and unidentified filenames (including the specified .o H header files and .a library files) are passed to the linker options (OPTIONS) in the order specified on the command line.

-fexternal-templates generates smaller code for template declarations (template declarations) (limited to C++) by generating a copy of each template function (template function) only at the place of its definition.
To use this option successfully, you must mark #pragma implementation (definition) or #Pragma interface (declaration) in all files that use templates.
When compiling with `-fexternal-templates', all template instantiations are external types. You must have the required instantiations in the implementation file.
This can be achieved with typedef, which references each instance required.
Correspondingly, if the compiler is used with the default option `-fno-external-templates', all template instantiations are explicitly set as built-in.
All member functions (except constructors and mnew or delete member operators) are treated as virtual functions of the class they are members of.
This does not mean that every call to a member function will go through the internal virtual function table.
In some cases, the compiler can determine that a virtual function can be called directly; in that case, it is called directly.
-fcond-mismatch allows the types of the second and third arguments of a conditional expression to mismatch.
The value of this expression is Void.-fthis—is—variable allows assignment to this (only in C++).
After merging user-defined free store management into C++, the assignable `this' is inappropriate.
Therefore, by default, internal assignment of this in a class member function is an invalid operation.
However, for backwards compatibility, you can make this operation valid by the `-fthis-is-variable` option.
-funsigned-char defines char as an unsigned type, like unsigned char.
Each machine has its own default char type. It can be unsigned char or signed char.
In an ideal world, when relying on the signedness of symbols, a portable program should always use signed char or unsigned char.
However, many programs have already been written using simple char, and they expect this to be a signed integer (or an unsigned integer, depending on the target machine of the program being written).
This option, and its opposite, make such programs work with the corresponding default.
The type of char should always be explicitly defined as signed char or unsigned char, even if it is exactly the same as one of them.
If neither `signed' nor `unsigned' is explicitly specified as a qualifier, these options define signed or unsigned bitfields.
By default, bit-fields are signed, because they inherit the basic integer types, such as int, which are signed integers, but if the -traditional option is specified, bit-fields are always unsigned.
-fwritable-strings stores string constants in writable data segments and does not make any special treatment.
This is to be compatible with some old programs that consider it a very bad idea to change string constants, and the `-traditional' option has the same effect.
Execute Summary
The Impact of COVID-19 on the Illicit Drug Market
Its impact may be similar to the 2008 economic crisis
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.

In many countries, this disease has caused medical services to be overwhelmed and on the verge of collapse, and the measures taken by governments to restrict it have caused serious disruptions in the global economy.
The impact of this epidemic on the drug market is not clear, and it is difficult to predict, but it may be profound.
Some producers may be forced to find new ways to produce drugs as restrictions on mobility also limit access to precursors and basic chemicals.
Traffickers, who are unable to travel due to restrictions, may have to find new routes and methods.
The patterns of drug use and supply may change, and governments' ability to respond may be hampered.
The changes brought about by COVID-19 are unprecedented, but there are lessons to be learned from past crises.
After the 2008 financial crisis, some drug addicts began to look for cheaper synthetic substances and switched to injecting drugs.
Meanwhile, governments have cut budgets related to drugs.

If governments respond to the current economic downturn in the same way, prevention measures such as drug abuse prevention and related risky behaviors, as well as drug addiction treatment services, may be hit hard.
In addition, the priority of interdiction and international cooperation may be reduced, making it easier for dealers to operate.
Some countries have smuggled a large amount of drugs through commercial flights, and it is estimated that these countries will suffer the most direct impact from drug trafficking.
Couriers have been known to carry precursor chemicals such as methamphetamine in their pockets or conceal them in their luggage, sometimes in large quantities.
Although the international postal supply chain has been disrupted, the activities of trafficking using the dark web and mail delivery may increase.
In the long term, economic recession and related measures may disrupt the drug market.

Due to rising unemployment and lack of opportunities, poverty and vulnerable populations are more likely to use drugs in harmful ways, develop drug use disorders, and engage in illicit activities related to drugs, whether production or transportation.
Drug trafficking organizations may exploit this situation by providing services to vulnerable populations and recruiting new members to bolster their ranks.
These changes may quickly take root as the new reality for many communities as government capacity declines.
Expansion and Complexity
market growth
the growth in population explains some of the reasons for the expansion of the market
The global drug use phenomenon has been increasing, both in terms of the overall number and the proportion of drug users in the world population.

In 2009, the estimated number of drug users was 210 million, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64, while in 2018, the estimated number of drug users was 269 million, accounting for 5.3% of this population.
In the past 20 years, the growth rate of drug addiction in developing countries is much faster than that in developed countries.

This to a certain extent reflects the difference in overall population growth during this period, with the developed countries growing by 7%, developing countries by 28%, but also reflects the fact that the young population in developing countries grew faster.
The proportion of young people and young adults in drug users is the largest.
Between 2000 and 2018, the population in this age group in developing countries grew by 16%, while the population in developed countries decreased by 10%.
1. Urbanization is a driving force for the current and future drug market
Whether it is developed countries or developing countries, the drug addiction situation in urban areas is more than that in rural areas.

The overall increase in drug addiction is partly due to the large-scale migration of population from rural areas to urban areas. At present, more than half of the world's population live in urban areas, while the proportion in 1960 was only 34%.
Urbanization may be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, especially in developing countries where urbanization trends are more pronounced.

The increase in drug use is associated with the increase in wealth, but the burden of disease is borne by the poorest people in the world, and drug use is more common in developed countries than in developing countries.
Cocaine and other drugs are more closely associated with wealthier regions of the world.
Similarly, within each country, the prevalence of drug addiction is higher among the richer social strata.
However, the ratio of addiction to drug-related diseases is relatively high among people with lower socio-economic status.
Data from a few countries show that the harmful use of drugs is associated with low income and disease.
These patterns seem less common in more affluent social strata.
The economic constraints caused by the global COVID-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risks faced by the most vulnerable populations, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labour market, such as rising unemployment, have historically been linked to increases in drug use, and this pandemic has already forced millions of people around the world out of work.

The COVID-19 pandemic could further expand the illicit drug market, as the pandemic's large-scale outbreak may lead to more farmers growing illicit crops, or because of the weakening control of national regulatory agencies, or because more people are forced to engage in illegal activities due to the economic crisis.
The related measures of COVID-19 may reduce air and land transportation, but increase sea transportation, which has a low risk of interception and more than air or land smuggling.
Recently, there have been reports of cocaine being transported directly from South America to Europe by sea.
complexity is enhanced
The emergence of non-controlled substances remains stable, but the new type of opioids with potential risks is increasing, and the drug market is becoming more and more complex.

In addition to plant-based substances such as cannabis, cocaine and heroin, hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added, many of which are not subject to international control. The non-medical use of drugs is also increasing rapidly.
Each year, there are about 500 new psychoactive substances in the domestic market of member countries.
Currently, most of them are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a small number of synthetic opioids.
Although the overall number of new psychoactive substances has stabilized, the proportion has changed.

In 2014, the number of new psychoactive substances confirmed as new types of psychoactive substances was 181, of which only 2% were new types of synthetic opioids, but this figure had risen to 9% by 2018.
Many of the new synthetic opioids are similar to fentanyl, and their effects and risks have been proven, causing overdose deaths in North America, and other regions, but the degree is lighter.
In North America, fentanyl is used as an adulterant for heroin and other drugs (including cocaine and methamphetamine) and as a substitute for illicit opioids.

Some evidence suggests that injecting new psychoactive stimulants is also happening in Europe: a study of discarded syringes in six European cities found that many were contaminated with substances that produce a stimulant effect.
The use of new psychoactive substances may become increasingly entrenched in disadvantaged groups
A single type of new psychoactive substance has never formed a large market.
However, evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among homeless and prison populations.
Twenty-two countries reported use of new psychoactive substances in prisons, with synthetic cannabinoids being the main challenge in most.

The control of precursor chemicals has forced manufacturers to innovate, with many chemicals used to synthesise buprenorphine, methamphetamine, amphetamine and "ecstasy" now under international control.
Traffickers and producers have long sought alternatives, not just those that are less controlled, but also those specifically designed to evade controls, namely so-called "designer precursors".
Restrictive measures aimed at preventing the spread of COVID-19 are likely to further squeeze synthetic precursor manufacturers.

Evidence from Mexico suggests that this has become a reality: it was reported in March 2020 that a shortage of methamphetamine precursors imported from Asia led to a rise in the price of methamphetamine in Mexico and the US.
The market is in a state of flux
Synthetic opioids replace opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
The heroin market in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have changed between 2008 and 2018.
The amount of opioids seized by the Russian federal authorities has dropped by about 80%, while the number of people receiving treatment for opioid use has dropped significantly.
But the stimulant market seems to be thriving.
There is evidence that methamphetamine and various cathinones, including mephedrone and a-pyrovalerone, are now widely available on the Russian drug market.

The number of clandestine laboratories producing illicit drugs discovered by Russian authorities has surged in recent years, more than doubling in the past two years, with 152 discovered in 2018, according to Russian authorities.
Afghanistan and Iraq methamphetamine markets grow
An investigation of hospital, prison and other staff in 2012 already revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq.
Crystal methamphetamine has become another major drug of concern, alongside heroin and tramadol.
A study in 2015 further confirmed these findings, with addicts saying cannabis was harder to get than "fenethylline" or methamphetamine.

Recently, Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine manufacturing sites, and the INCB has expressed concern about large quantities of pseudoephedrine-based preparations being imported for use in methamphetamine production.
In Afghanistan, methamphetamine production appears to have begun in 2014.
Since then, seizures of methamphetamine have been steadily rising.
But seizures in the first half of 2019 were 16.57 kg - a sharp increase from the previous year.
Large quantities of methamphetamine believed to have originated in Afghanistan have been seized in other countries, indicating that production is rapidly increasing.
Policy changes and trends
The legalization of non-medical cannabis use has been accompanied by a trend towards increased cannabis use.
Eleven jurisdictions in Canada, Uruguay and the US allow the production of cannabis products for non-medical use.
In most jurisdictions, cannabis use has increased since legalization, although the same trend has been observed in other jurisdictions that have not legalized non-medical use.

In the two earliest states to pass legislation, Colorado and Washington , the prevalence of nonmedical cannabis use among adults has increased, especially in the past month and daily or almost daily use, which has been above the national average since 2012 .
All indicators show that marijuana use in Uruguay has increased since 2011, and last month it almost doubled.
This increase was mainly due to frequent use.
Canadian short-term data also shows that as the legal market expanded from 2018 to 2019, usage also increased.
However, in 2019, 40% of cannabis users still obtained some products illegally.
Is the dramatic decline in global cannabis herb seizures due to cannabis legalization?
In 2018, global seizures of cannabis herb reached the lowest level in the past 20 years, because seizures in North America dropped by 84% over the past 10 years.
In contrast, seizures in other parts of the world almost doubled. The seizure pattern suggests that policies aimed at loosening the cannabis market are having a key impact.
Monitoring of new psychoactive substances appears to have had some impact on the domestic market, but it is still difficult to assess the impact of monitoring of new psychoactive substances.
Some countries with different regulatory regimes for new psychoactive substances have shown different rates of use of new psychoactive substances.
In other countries, the use of new psychoactive substances has decreased after domestic legislation.

Disadvantaged populations are disproportionately harmed by both legal and illegal drug markets for opioids used for pain management and palliative care , with opioid use varying widely by region and income level .
In 2018 , more than 90 % of all medical consumption of opioids were in high income countries .
About 50% in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
These countries accounted for approximately 12 % of the global population .
It is estimated that the population of low- and middle-income countries accounts for 88% of the global population, but the consumption of pharmaceutical opioids is less than 10%.
the barriers to obtaining opioids are multifactorial , including legislation , culture , health systems , and prescribing practices .
The risk of addiction is greater for poorer people. In 2018, about 35.6 million people were addicted to drugs.

Poverty, limited education, and social marginalization may increase the risk of opioid use disorder and worsen its consequences. Evidence from high-income countries shows that these individual disadvantages - which are not just a snapshot of someone's situation at a particular point in time - are also associated with the risk of opioid use disorder.

Addiction also exacerbates social and economic disadvantage, further increasing the risks of unemployment, poverty and homelessness, and perpetuating the vicious cycle of disadvantage. These outcomes may also be linked to the stigmatising attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system.

Women, ethnic minorities, migrants, diverse sexual orientations, people displaced by armed conflict or disaster, and those living in rural environments are also likely to be disproportionately affected by opioid use or to face challenges in accessing treatment.

The harmful effects of smoking on a broader range of social influences have worsened over the past decade, as measured by the disability-adjusted life year (DALY) indicator, which estimates the number of healthy life years lost due to disability and premature death.
Between 2007 and 2018, the global disability-adjusted life years lost due to drug use increased by 17%.
The increase in DALYs from untreated hepatitis C-related liver cancer among injecting drug users was particularly high - 40%.
The relationship between drugs and violence is complex and difficult to determine the causal relationship between substance use and violence.
Global data suggest that drunkenness may be an important factor in homicide.
But in violent events, alcohol seems to have a greater effect than drugs.

Although drug use may be associated with crime, in some cases this association can be partially attributed to multiple mediating factors, such as social and economic disadvantage and other types of adversity that are influenced by personal risk, family environment, and peers.
The link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, including large scale organized crime, it is possible that these activities can be carried out without violence.

In the short term, the presence and degree of violence are more likely to depend on the quantity of the drug being trafficked than on some change that makes the power balance between organized criminal groups unstable, such as changes in the size of the illegal market, the death or imprisonment of known criminals, or law enforcement measures that make one group weaker than another.
The latest trends
Marijuana is the most commonly used substance and opioids pose the greatest risk
An estimated 192 million people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug globally.
In comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
But the related harms of opioids are often overlooked because of the relatively small number of users.

In 2017, an estimated 167,000 deaths were related to drug use, 66% of which were caused by these substances, and 50% of the 210 million years of life lost due to premature death or disability caused by drug use were caused by these substances.
Synthetic opioid nonmedical use exacerbates public health crisis

In West Africa, Central Africa and North Africa, the enhanced opioid crisis is tramadol; in North America, it is fentanyl. These regions have almost no commonalities in economic, demographic or general drug use patterns, but they are all struggling to combat the opioid crisis fueled by easily accessible and cheap substances.
In North America, the use of synthetic opioids such as fentanyl has led to a surge in opioid overdose deaths over the past 20 years.
In 2018, fentanyl was involved in two-thirds of the 67,367 overdose deaths registered in the US.
Canada has reported similar results, with lower numbers.
One reason fentanyl is contributing to overdose deaths is that the potency of illicit fentanyl is unpredictable.
The market for tramadol used for non-medical purposes has grown significantly in West Africa, Central Africa and North Africa.
In that region, more and more people using tramadol for pain relief are seeking treatment.
In 2017, the global seizure of tramadol reached a peak of over 125 tons, a significant increase.
But in 2018, after India passed a new law to regulate tramadol, global seizures fell to 3,200 kg.
The two crises were fuelled by the simplicity and low cost of production, as well as the lack of international oversight of tramadol and many fentanyl analogues or their precursors.
The two crises were worsened by the fact that these substances are available on both the legal and illegal markets, making it harder to detect and prevent their misuse.
The use of stimulants is on the rise
The stimulant sector is dominated by cocaine and methamphetamine, both of which are seeing rising use in their main markets.
About 19 million people used cocaine in 2018, because cocaine is popular in North America and Western Europe.
Some 27 million people used methamphetamine that year, with methamphetamine hydrochloride being the most commonly used methamphetamine type in Southeast Asia and North America.
According to most indicators, the use of methamphetamine in these two regions has been expanding for 20 years.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist, sometimes substituting for each other, so that when one drug's use goes up, the other goes down, sometimes both increasing and decreasing at the same time to meet the same market demand.
COVID-19 increases the risk of injection drug users
An estimated 11.3 million people inject drugs in 2018, and about 10% of the global HIV infections are caused by injecting drug use.
More than 100,000 people who inject drugs have HIV, and 5.5 million have Hepatitis C.
In 2017, about 585,000 people died of drug addiction, half of them died of liver disease caused by hepatitis C, and most of the hepatitis C in injecting drug users is still untreated.
5. The shortage of opioids caused by the COVID-19 restrictions may lead to users substituting with alcohol or benzodiazepines, which are easier to obtain, or mixing opioids with synthetic drugs.
With some users switching to injecting or injecting more frequently, there may be more harmful use.

EU Summit Debates Refugee Policy, EU Officials: The Process of Acceptance is Getting Bottlenecked-ChinaNews.com
Conflicts over refugee policy dominate EU summit; EU officials: every step in the reception process is a bottleneck

[Global Times Brussels Special Reporter Niu Ruifeng] According to Agence France-Presse on February 10, at the latest EU summit, European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker said that EU leaders agreed to adopt stricter policies on illegal immigration to make it easier to expel illegal immigrants.

According to the report, the EU's move is a response to the growing concern of the increasing number of illegal immigrants in Europe. The core problem of the EU now is that the number of illegal immigrants who can be expelled is very small.

According to the summit document, EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" to strengthen the external borders through infrastructure and monitoring measures.
However, the European Union and its member states have been arguing over the payment of the cost of the border.
Von der Leyen repeatedly said that the EU funds would not pay for the costs.

But some diplomats from member countries said that if the EU could bear the cost of installing cameras, observation towers and other facilities along the external borders, it would help accelerate the construction process.

The European Euractiv website said that EU officials admitted that there was a bottleneck in every step of the refugee reception process, limited reception capacity and the immigration authorities of member states could not prevent refugees from submitting "endless" asylum applications to EU countries, and the EU refugee reception system was in a state of "near permanent crisis".
According to the European Commission, the asylum applications received by the EU member states last year exceeded 920,000, which was nearly half of the previous year.
At the same time, the European Union recorded more than 330,000 illegal border crossings last year.

Against this background, the summit also reached a "principle" agreement on a "judgment" that EU countries can return illegal immigrants to another member state based on the judgment of the latter's court.
In addition, the EU leaders agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries", which will open the way for the EU to establish a common list.
(Source: Global Times, author: Ni Ruifeng)
US upgrades "chip war" to create a new global semiconductor industry - China News

Recently, the US has made a significant upgrade to the "chip war" against China. First, the Netherlands and Japan agreed to control the export of semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China under US pressure; then, foreign media reported that the US government was considering cutting off all connections between US suppliers and Huawei, and prohibiting US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei; the Biden government also prepared to issue an administrative order to restrict US investment in China's sensitive technology industries

In recent years, the US has never stopped its actions to suppress China's "core" development. On the one hand, it has precisely targeted the supply chain of semiconductor production for China, and on the other hand, it has built a semiconductor industry alliance to de-Sinicize, with the aim of completely "throwing off" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is to attract South Korea to establish a "technology alliance", or to establish a "chip quadrilateral alliance" with South Korea, Japan and Taiwan, or to establish a semiconductor industry "small circle" through the mechanism of the US-Japan-Australia "four-party mechanism" and the "Indo-Pacific Economic Framework", the United States has introduced political, partisan, and weaponized means into the semiconductor industry to
However, the US’s “chip warfare” against China is also “wounding the enemy and wounding oneself”.

Recently, ASML, a global leader in lithography, warned that the ban on exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China may lead to a rise in semiconductor prices.

The so-called suppression of China's advanced semiconductor industry by the United States has dragged down the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry, and a global semiconductor industry chain has already formed.

According to the estimation of experts, based on specialized division of labor, the entire production process of semiconductor products needs to cross the border of more than 70 countries, and the whole process takes 100 days.

Although the US semiconductor industry has a strong foundation, it is relatively weak in manufacturing, especially in advanced processes and technology, and is heavily dependent on the Asia-Pacific region.

Even if the United States strives to lead the advanced semiconductor production and supply chain to develop into a "small circle" regionalization, it is difficult to change the regional distribution and interdependence of global semiconductor-related industries.
The United States is strongly "restructuring" and "de-Sinicization" of the semiconductor industry chain, and re-creating the global semiconductor industry.
Chips are the core of the future industry, and the development of the chip industry cannot be separated from the participation of all countries in the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, including the America COMPETES Act of 2022, the America COMPETES Act, and the America COMPETES Act, to consolidate its technological advantages and lead the world in the field of chips by using its technological hegemony; and it has also "bribed and coerced" its allies to lure Intel, TSMC, Samsung and other chip manufacturing enterprises to
In the short term, the United States has indeed caused trouble for China's chip industry and related industries, and has gained real benefits.

However, in the long run, the US’s hysteria and pressure on China’s semiconductor industry will force China to continuously break through, and the US will lose a huge Chinese market, which will ultimately greatly weaken the innovative desire and ability of American technology companies, and harm the development of the global semiconductor industry.

The first batch of personal pension financial products is on sale, the shortest holding period is only 360 days-China News
The first batch of personal pension financial products is on sale
Seven products of household appliances can be selected, and the minimum holding period is 360 days.
The personal pension insurance product finally went online.

On February 10, China Finance Network released the list of the first batch of personal pension products. The seven personal pension products of Postal Finance, Agricultural Bank of China Finance and China Postal Savings Bank officially went on sale.

At present, the "shelves" of personal pension account have finally gathered personal pension savings, personal pension financial products, personal pension insurance, and personal pension public fund four types of products.

According to the introduction, the first batch of personal pension financial products are all public offerings of clean value type open products, of which 5 are new products, 2 are continuous products, except for 1 mixed product, the other 6 products are all fixed income products.

Reporters of Beijing Youth Daily saw that of the 5 new products, 4 were from the Bank of Communications Financial Services, all of which were fixed income products, with the shortest holding period being 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70%-4.20%, 4.10%-4.

The remaining new product is "Postal Savings Bank Financial Addition of Hengjin No. 1 with a shortest holding period of 1095 days", which is also a fixed income product, and the fundraising started on February 10 and ended on February 19, with a risk level of II.

One of the two continuing products is the "Agricultural Bank Financial Product with the Name of Agricultural Bank Dynamic" 360-day Technology Innovation RMB Financial Product of the Agricultural Bank of China, which is a mixed investment product with risk level of level III.

The other continuing product is "Postal Savings Bank of China Financial Addition-Hongjin No. 1 with a shortest holding period of 365 days", which is a fixed income product. It started to collect funds on December 30 last year, officially started to operate on January 4 this year, and its accumulated net value on February 8 was 1.0011.

According to the "Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Exhibition of Personal Retirement Savings", the financial products that can be invested with the funds of personal retirement savings account include bank wealth management products, savings deposits, commercial pension insurance, public funds, etc.

The first batch of individual retirement savings financial products was sold, marking that the investors of individual retirement savings can buy financial products through the individual retirement savings account.
In November last year, the CBRC issued the Temporary Measures for the Management of Personal Retirement Savings Accounts of Commercial Banks and Financial Institutions.

The Regulations stipulate that the participants can purchase personal pension savings, personal pension fund products, personal pension insurance products, personal pension fund products, etc. through personal pension fund accounts.

Subsequently, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance and the State Administration of Taxation issued a notice, clarifying that the personal pension system was launched and implemented in 36 pilot cities and regions including Beijing, Tianjin, Hebei Shijiazhuang, Xiong'an New Area, Shanxi Jincheng, etc.

By the end of 2022, the number of participants in the personal pension insurance was 19.54 million, the number of contributors was 6.13 million, and the total amount of contributions was 14.2 billion yuan.

Previously, only the three types of products, namely, personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public fund products, were listed on the banks participating in the pilot.
Now that the financial products of personal pension have gathered, how should investors choose?

A specialist from the ICBC Financial Product Research Department said that compared with other personal pension products, the pension financial products and personal pension financial products in the pilot stage have three features.
First, it is stable. The risk management mechanism is more complete, and the investment strategy and concept are more stable, and non-parent company independent custody is implemented.

Second, it is long-term. The maturity of the retirement financial products in the pilot stage is all above 5 years, and the next individual retirement financial products, the minimum holding period is generally 1 year, and it is encouraged to hold for 3 years or more.

The third is the universality. The purchase threshold of the product is low, and the purchase point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan. The custody fee, management fee and other fees are more preferential.
Experts suggest that investors should choose products based on the product features and their risk tolerance.

The personal pension savings have the characteristics of longer term, higher interest rate and higher safety, which are suitable for people with weak risk tolerance; the personal pension insurance products focus on guaranteeing, which are more suitable for people who cannot bear investment risks and can accept stable returns; while the personal pension financial products and public fund products are not guaranteed to return the principal and interest, but have certain investment risks, but the expected returns are higher, which are suitable for people with certain financial knowledge and strong risk

Fitness Industry Should Overcome Trust Crisis - China News
Another large fitness club "thunderbolt"?
Recently, the issue of the rights of members of the well-known fitness club, Jianjian, has attracted public attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not operating normally. Subsequently, rumors about the closure and flight of the organization caused members to panic, and the public security and human resources departments intervened.

Finally, the relevant person in charge of the organization came forward to respond and promised to make efforts to protect the legal rights and interests of employees and members, thus the storm was calmed down.

Some fitness centers have encountered business problems and temporarily closed some of their stores. Consumers can remain calm and wait for the problem to be resolved. Why are many members’ first reactions “something is wrong”?
Behind the wave of member rights protection in the fitness club, there is a deep-rooted problem of trust crisis in the industry.
In China, traditional fitness clubs generally adopt the pre-paid fee model, and “earning money from customers who don’t come” is the underlying logic of their development.

Through the pre-sale of membership cards to obtain cash flow, and continuously opening new stores, it seems to be able to form a cycle, but in fact it is a case of "eating the rice of others", and it is impossible to form a stable profit model.
The negative information about the fitness club and other industries is frequent, which has a strong impact on consumer confidence.
From the perspective of market prospects, fitness clubs are indeed a good business with “money-making potential”.
The fitness track is volatile, but it is always paid attention to by capital.
A lot of data shows that the heat in the field of physical consumption is continuously rising, and the market is continuously warming up.

Specifically, in the fitness market, with the steady improvement of residents’ living standards, the concept of healthy living has become deeply rooted in people’s minds, and the fitness industry has great potential for development.
The better the trend, the more important it is to develop quality.

However, individual institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the consumption recovery, and they are blowing the horn of expanding the territory and opening new stores, and they are pouring all the investment funds into the construction of new stores.

It cannot be denied that, due to the influence of the epidemic, many institutions have withdrawn from the market, and the industry has been reshuffled, and some enterprises with real strength have selectively increased their acquisition strength and restructured, which is a new opportunity.
However, to develop the fitness market and enter a virtuous circle, the industry must change its traditional mode and adjust its operating strategy.
Only by stabilizing and consolidating, and re-establishing the trust and safety of consumers, can we truly win the market and the future.
Compared with the large-scale construction of new stores to seize the market, the fitness industry currently needs to focus on optimizing services and use high-quality development to stabilize users.
First, it is necessary to retain users through services.

Fitness clubs belong to the service industry, and their essence is to adhere to "customer-oriented", to focus on the needs of customers, and to put the center of management on the upgrading of services.
Secondly, it is necessary to upgrade the user experience through digital transformation.
For example, the popular Internet fitness club model allows users to pay by the session and choose their own location.
At the same time, body data and exercise data can be effectively utilized, and social needs can also be met, realizing the complete service loop from online to offline.
Without personal training promotion and high-priced annual membership, users' concerns about "running away" from fitness institutions have been reduced, and trust has also been improved.
In addition, it is also necessary to actively explore multiple business models.

Now, sports consumption has evolved from single service to scene consumption, and fitness clubs are likely to become new consumption entrances, and the surrounding products such as sports supplements and fitness equipment will become new profit points, providing consumers with more choices.
JIANG Tianjie
Buy and sell, and refund the difference!
Nanjing Loushi recreates "price difference refund" - China News

Yangtze Evening Post (Reporter: Ma Xiaobo) Yangtze Evening Post/Zhuniu News Reporter, on the 10th, found in an interview that the “price guarantee agreement” that hadn’t been seen for over a decade had returned to Nanjing Loushi, a real estate company in the Jiangbei New District, which claimed to be “paying the difference”, and the discounts on other properties before
The conditions for the "price guarantee agreement" are not few

The apartment is called Bolai Yuzhou Tianyi Tower, located in the Jiangbei New District. Mr. Sun, who came to visit the apartment, told the reporter that he found a "declaration" when he visited the apartment last weekend.

The picture he sent to the reporter shows that the developer of the building promises that if the buyer buys the house between February 1 and February 28, the developer will refund the difference in price between the price of the house and the price of the house that the buyer originally bought, if the discount of the other houses in the project is greater than the discount that the buyer originally enjoyed (limited to the owner-occupied houses of the same type, the same building, the same unit

Mr. Sun said that the real estate consultant said that this was actually a “price guarantee agreement”, the purpose of which was to let buyers feel at ease and not worry about the developer lowering prices to sell the property, “I’m afraid that if I buy it, they will lower the price, and I’ll have to go to the sales office to argue, but if I don’t argue, I’ll feel uneasy.”
However, many buyers think that the “price guarantee agreement” is just a “pill of courage” for buyers, but the conditions are not low.
Zheng lady, who plans to buy a house in Jingbei, said that the houses with price guarantee must be of the same type, in the same building and the same unit, so the "threshold" is still high.
Some buyers also think that due to the information asymmetry, the developer may give extra benefits when selling, so it is not easy for buyers to "exercise their rights".
Whether it can retain buyers remains to be seen

The reporter learned from the online real estate website of Nanjing that the sale of the two buildings of the apartment last year in November was 252 units in total, with the floor area of the room ranging from 105 square meters to 114 square meters and 129 square meters, and the price of the fully furnished sale was 39,843 yuan/square meter.

However, in the past two months, the online real estate shows that the total number of unsold units in the project is 157, accounting for 62.3%, of which 128 units are in the 8th floor, and the number of unsold units is 113, and 124 units are in the 7th floor, and 44 units are unsold, and the total number of units sold is only 3
Market insiders introduced that the “price guarantee agreement” had also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, the Huangshan Road, Hexi District, Tongxian West Garden of the Housing Development Project in Huangshan Road, Hexi District, launched the "Price Guarantee Plan" to attract buyers, the specific content of which was "the company solemnly promises that if the discount of the project is expanded within one year, the difference will be refunded to the original owner by the company".
In April 2011, nine real estate projects in Nanjing also offered some housing units with a commitment to “pay the difference”.
"The housing market is warming up, and it needs a 'stimulant' more than ever.
"Nanjing's real estate industry veteran Mr. Shen said, "price guarantee agreement is also a marketing method for real estate companies.
He believed that developers needed more confidence than buyers at present, and the "price guarantee" was actually a way to boost their confidence.
As for whether they can retain buyers, he said that it depends on the impact of multiple factors such as the control policy and loan threshold, and it is still under observation.

Experts believe that the performance of Taiwan's economy at the beginning of the year was not good, and the pressure of growth was not small.

According to the financial affairs management department of the Taiwan government, the export of the Taiwan region in January this year was US$31.51 billion, down by 21.2% year-on-year, and the fifth consecutive month of negative growth.
The export value of 11 major export commodities decreased compared with the same period last year.
The decline of plastic rubber and its products, and optical equipment, is the most significant, with a year-on-year decrease of 37.6% and 35.7%, respectively.
The export of electronic components decreased by 20.1% year on year, the largest decrease in 11 years.
Among them, the integrated circuit fell by 18.3% year-on-year, the largest decline in the past 14 years.

Cai Meina, the director of the statistics department of the Ministry of Finance, said that this shows that the demand for consumer electronics is weakening, and the electronics industry is entering the correction period.
According to statistics, the import and export of Taiwan region in January fell by 23.4 billion US dollars, the lowest level in nearly 3 years.

The financial management department of the Taiwan government believes that the global terminal demand has decreased, the industry adjustment of inventory has suppressed the willingness of merchants to purchase raw materials, and the export situation is very poor, and it is difficult to see an improvement in the short term. The export decline in the first quarter of Taiwan this year may be higher than expected.

According to the Taiwan Chung-Hua Institution for Economic Research, the Taiwan manufacturing Purchasing Managers’ Index (PMI) for January 2020 was 40.4% after seasonal adjustment, which was 3.3 percentage points lower than that of December 2019, and continued to contract for the seventh consecutive month.
In the economic monitoring index system, PMI is the demarcation line of 50%, and the index is greater than 50% represents the expansion of the situation, otherwise it is the contraction.
In the five components of the PMI of Taiwan in January, new orders, production and employment were contracting, delivery time of suppliers was falling, and inventory was shrinking.

All six industries reported a contraction of PMI, and the ranking of the contraction speed was power and machinery equipment industry (35.1%), electronic and optoelectronic industry (35.2%), chemical and biotechnology industry (39.2%), basic raw materials industry (42.4%), transportation equipment industry (42.6%), and food and textile industry (45.7%).

In terms of prices, the “Department of Budget, Accounting and Statistics” of the Taiwan government announced that the annual increase of the CPI in Taiwan in January was 3.04%, which broke the 3% again since July last year.
Among them, the price of vegetables rose by 28.25%, a new high for 17 months.

Cao Zhihong, a special commissioner of the Taiwan Ministry of Finance, admitted that the price of vegetables had indeed exceeded expectations, excluding the Spring Festival factor, the average CPI in January and February this year should be close to 2.71% in December last year, and the inflationary pressure still exists and is still high.
Looking forward to Taiwan's economy this year, according to the reports of the island's media such as United Daily News and "Yahoo Finance", experts are pessimistic.

Wu Da Ren, professor of economics at the Central University in Taiwan, analyzed that the export downturn may cause cash flow problems for export manufacturing enterprises, and the risk of debt default will rise.
At the same time, the reduction of orders led to the reduction of labor costs for enterprises, which affected the labor market and family economy, and in turn affected consumption ability.

Taiwan Institute of Economic Research researcher Qiu Dashuai believes that the inflation situation in Europe and America will not be resolved this year, and the demand will continue to shrink, and the export decline in Taiwan will continue until the first half of the year.
Due to the fact that Taiwan's economy relies on exports, it is affected by the low export, the annual economic growth will not be as good as last year.

Report: The number of returning students seeking employment in 2022 reached a new high - China News
The top 10 countries for returning students seeking employment in 2022 - Source: 2022 China Returnee Employment Survey Report

Beijing, February 11 (door.com.cn) (by Meng Rui) The recently published 2022 China Returnee Employment Survey Report (hereinafter referred to as the “report”) shows that the scale of graduating students increased by 8.6% year-on-year in 2022, and the number of returning students seeking employment reached a new high, and the demand for foreign talents from Chinese enterprises also showed an upward
The report pointed out that the number of returning students seeking employment in China has significantly increased since 2020, and the number of returning students seeking employment has increased.
Compared with 2021, the number of students returning to China in 2022 increased by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of students returning to China seeking employment reached a new high.

From the distribution of countries where students go to seek employment after returning home, the UK has the highest proportion, which is 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the United States (9%), which is consistent with 2021.

From the perspective of year-on-year growth, the number of applicants for employment from Malaysia, Japan and Singapore in 2022 increased significantly, with growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9% and 37.7% respectively.
The number of incoming students from Canada, Germany, the United States, and Australia decreased compared with the previous year.
The first week of the supply and demand of returnees after the Spring Festival in 2023. Source: “2022 China Returnees Employment Survey Report”

The survey shows that 58% of the students who decided to return to China think that "life in China is more convenient", 40% of them decided to return to China because they "feel more at home in the Chinese culture", 32% of them think that "there are more job opportunities in China", and 22% of them think that "the economic activities in China will recover faster, and there will be more job opportunities".
Data shows that the demand for foreign talents from domestic enterprises is rapidly released, and the demand for returning talents is on the rise.

After the Spring Festival in 2023, the number of priority positions for returning overseas students and the number of returning overseas students seeking employment in the country both showed an upward trend. The number of priority positions for returning overseas students on February 3 was 11% higher than that on January 28, and the number of returning overseas students seeking employment increased by 27%.

From the perspective of industries, in the 2022 returning talent priority positions, the positions from the education/training industry accounted for 27.8%, ranking first, and the professional services/consulting and the Internet/e-commerce industries ranked second and third, with 14.3% and 11.1% respectively.
The number of returning students seeking employment in the country in recent years - Source: 2022 China Returnees Employment Survey Report

From the salary, the average recruitment salary of the priority positions for returning overseas students has been rising continuously for three years, reaching 14,680 yuan/month (RMB, the same below) in 2022, which is 961 yuan higher than that of 2021, and the increase is 7%.

From the perspective of regions, the intention of the returning population to develop in new first-tier cities, second-tier cities and third-tier cities and below in 2022 has been improved, and the proportion of investment was 31%, 15.7%, and 14.3%, respectively, all of which were higher than the proportion of investment in 2021.
For the yield of studying abroad, 52.7% of the returning overseas Chinese said it basically met their expectations, up 2.8 percentage points from last year (49.9%).
28.2% of the returning students said that their income was higher than expected, and this proportion was higher than that of 2021, which was 25.4%.
(End)

Patient He Yun: After the new policy, the doctor said that it would cost around 8,000 yuan, almost half of the previous price.

ChinaNews.com, February 11 -- According to the "Shenzhen Work and Information" WeChat public account on February 10, the Shenzhen Municipal Bureau of Industry and Information Technology recently issued the "Shenzhen Rapid Development City Construction Action Plan".

Among them, it is proposed to build a high-speed, large-capacity, and low-latency super broadband network by the end of 2023, and achieve the goal of "double gigabit, full optical fiber, 1 millisecond, and everything connected" network construction, and build a domestic first and world-leading super-fast leading city.
The plan proposes to speed up the upgrade of gigabit optical networks.
By the end of 2023, the proportion of 10G PON ports will reach 100%, and the number of all-optical industrial parks (industrial parks) will exceed 100.
The plan requires that the energy efficiency of 5G network be improved comprehensively.
Research and establish the standard of Shenzhen 5G network service quality, conduct 5G network test and evaluation, and improve the quality of 5G network service.

Supporting telecommunications enterprises to increase the optimization degree of 5G networks in key areas and places, 10,000 new 5G base stations will be added annually, the average downloading speed in the city will reach 500Mbps, the uploading speed will reach 100Mbps, the downloading speed in key areas will reach 1000Mbps, the uploading speed will reach 20
Build a city-level high-quality wireless local area network.

Formulate the service standard of public wireless local area network (WLAN), promote the upgrading of WLAN in densely populated and information consumption areas in each district, and provide 1000Mbps access ability.

Build a unified certification and management platform for the city's public wireless local area network "Shenzheni Network" to realize "one-time certification, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching", and support the operating subject to include the social self-built AP (wireless access point) with public service capabilities in the certification management platform.
By the end of 2023, the number of upgraded access APs will not be less than 20,000.

In addition, the Plan also proposes to build a high-quality all-optical power network, construct a multi-level computing power supply system, speed up the construction of key communication network facilities, and enhance the ability of Internet application services.
The Plan clearly states that it will collaborate to build a sensing system.

Explore the construction of the terminal construction management mode based on the "open source Huawei Mongoose" operating system, reduce the cost of interconnection, and accelerate the construction of city-level IoT perception platforms. Promote the construction of regional IoT platforms, network and data interconnection of IoT platforms in various fields.

Deepen the application of urban sensing in urban management, public services, public security, transportation, and other fields, and expand the fixed sensing and intelligent networked vehicles as the collection channels for sensing in urban roads, buildings, public facilities, and other fixed sensing.
By the end of 2023, the number of water, electricity and gas IoT sensing terminals will exceed 9 million, and 20 multi-functional smart lamppost application demonstration projects will be built.

The plan also mentions strengthening the application of satellite and ground communications integration, building the basic facilities of low-altitude networks, and promoting the deep coverage of 5G networks at sea.
At the same time, promote the deep coverage of marine 5G network, build an industrial innovation and development ecology, and support the holding of top-level competitions and activities.

E-commerce industry in China is facing a new variable, how to make delivery “content is king”?
-chinanews.com
ChinaNews.com, February 11th, Title: The emergence of new variables in China's e-commerce industry, how to make delivery the king of content?
Xia Bin, reporter of China News Finance
"We entered the e-commerce market a bit late, but we realized from the very beginning that in order to stand out from the millions of stores, content is very important.
"Guangdong '90s girl" Flora, who is in her 20s, now runs a supplementary food store on Douyin e-commerce, helping a 30-year-old offline store to "bloom online".
With the style of old Hong Kong movies and classic Cantonese songs, @芳芳 opened a one-person food shop on Douyin, and the beautiful video was a new surprise.

At the recent "Seeking Peers·Quality Content Sharing Special" of Douyin e-commerce, Fangfang, as a representative of quality content creators, spoke on stage and introduced her experience and feelings of daily creation.

She said on the spot, "The carefully crafted video has attracted a lot of attention from netizens. Many people are interested in our ingredients and want to cook together. The sales have suddenly increased.

Fangfang relies on the pot soup video to make more people love the taste of "Guangdong", and the live broadcast can sell up to 300,000 supplementary food materials, which saved the family's old store from closing down.
"No content, no e-commerce", with the continuous development of short videos and live e-commerce, people's requirements and standards for e-commerce content have entered a new stage.
In the early stage of live broadcast sales, the live room often used low prices and discounts to attract users, and the price advantage seemed to be the only selling point at that time.

In recent years, there are not only phenomenon-level big Vs such as Will Liu and Dongfang Zhuanxuan, but also many experts and merchants in the vertical field that are not well known to the public. They have continuously created high-quality content that fits their brand personality, thus improving their long-term operating benefits.

High Yankang, the operator and manager of Douyin e-commerce star authors, said that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have turned their content into reality through Douyin e-commerce, and their content creation volume has increased by 252%, and the total transaction volume has doubled.
“Behind these numbers, we can feel a vibrant and lively author ecology.
"Said Ga Yankang.

Before the release of the report, Beijing Normal University Communication Innovation and Future Media Experiment Platform had published the "E-commerce Industry Content Ecosystem Health Index (ECHI) Report", which analyzed the importance of the "new variable" - high-quality content in the current e-commerce industry from the data dimension, and used the index to evaluate the content ecosystem of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the ECHI ranking of the e-commerce industry content ecology health index report, Douyin Shop, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com ranked the top five.

The report believes that the e-commerce content ecology is a comprehensive concept, which is to integrate e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. Good PGC (professional produced content) and UGC (user-generated content) are the quality carriers that can be integrated with e-commerce, and the higher the value of the content platform, the richer the scene of consumption and promotion, and the higher the possibility of e-commerce

At the scene, Professor Yim Guoming, the director of the Chinese Media Economy and Management Special Committee of Beijing Normal University Journalism and Communication College, analyzed and interpreted the report.

He said that in terms of content value, the e-commerce industry has already entered the stage of “consumption quality”, and high-quality, specialized, and differentiated content is the “hard currency” of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the foundation and grasp of the new stage of e-commerce development, and PGC content such as knowledge payment, professional knowledge, and KOL (key opinion leader) have become standard configurations of e-commerce live broadcast.
Looking to the future development of e-commerce industry, Yim Guoming made two suggestions from two aspects.

One is from the perspective of the improvement of the structure of the content, to promote the overall improvement of the health and quality of the e-commerce content ecology, to build positive standards for content creation and management, and to achieve the dynamic balance of the e-commerce content ecology health index system.
The other is from the external ecology, to realize the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value of co-creation and cooperation with the external environment.

“In the future, the e-commerce industry still needs more data and support from artificial intelligence to make predictions about future stability; in addition, it is necessary to provide a more regulated and healthy growth space for merchants to realize the value of cooperation between enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry and create a healthy content ecology.
“(complete)

Chinese rescue team continues to carry out rescue operations in Turkey, rescued 4 people - China News

Xinhuanet, February 11 -- According to the website of the Ministry of Emergency Management on the 11th, on February 10, the Chinese rescue team dispatched 3 mobile teams and 45 rescue personnel to Turkey for rescue, and rescued one person.
At the same time, two search and evaluation teams were dispatched to assess and inspect the 15 buildings on Wodabash Street.
Up to now, 4 people have been rescued, 5 people have been found, and 25 severely collapsed buildings have been searched for life signs and risk assessment.
The rescue team will scientifically adjust the rescue force according to the actual situation of the disaster area and the rescue scene, and continue to carry out rescue work in depth.

The rescue team obtained the rescue appeal information through various channels such as embassies, local governments, and UN rescue organizations, and verified it through online inquiry, on-site search, and other means.
The Chinese rescue team introduced the current rescue environment and the situation of building collapse to the Hong Kong rescue team, and they jointly conducted search operations.

At present, the Chinese rescue team is working with the Italian rescue team to coordinate the regional rescue work (SSC5), and three members of the team are participating in the work of the 5th regional rescue coordination center, communicating with the Italian, British, Serbian, Slovak, Oman and other rescue teams to understand the situation of the United Nations rescue organization and the rescue work of the rescue teams of various countries.

The rescue team continued to strengthen safety management and team protection, and according to the principle of "unity of command and safety first", strengthened the safety control of the rescue site, strengthened the discipline requirements of rescue work, and clarified the safety precautions.
Continuously operate the shift duty and sentry duty system and strengthen the safety management of the camp.

The medical personnel of the rescue team provide daily health check-up services for the team members, strengthen the medical protection of key personnel, and all members of the rescue team are currently in good health, and the camp disinfection is carried out.

After the camp was set up, the logistics support personnel built 4 categories and 26 tents of command communication, equipment storage, medical cleaning, living accommodation and kennels to ensure the rescue equipment on the site.

(Deutsche Welle Chinese) On Friday, February 10, the Biden government will list 6 Chinese entities suspected of involvement in the suspected espionage balloon plan in the blacklist.

The US Department of Commerce said that these five Chinese companies and one research institute helped the Chinese military to modernize, especially in the field of aerospace, including aircraft and helicopters.
Companies on the blacklist will find it difficult to obtain US technology exports.

The list is called the "entity list", and companies on the list will not be able to buy technology or goods from U.S. suppliers unless they receive a special export license from the U.S. Commerce Department.

The companies on the blacklist are Beijing Nanjiang Space Technology Co., Ltd., the 48th Research Institute of China Electronics Technology Group Corporation, Dongguan Lingshan Remote Sensing Technology Co., Ltd., Tianma Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xingong Aviation Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Tianma Aviation Technology Group Co., Ltd.

Before this, the White House said that it was considering to take broader measures to "expose and deal with" the larger surveillance activities that threaten the national security of the United States.
The balloon incident has further strained the US-China relationship, and US Secretary of State Blinken has canceled his visit to China.

The Chinese government lodged a solemn protest with the US embassy in China on February 4, condemning the US for seriously violating and damaging the efforts and progress of both sides to stabilize the China-US relationship.

From existing wreckage evidence and information from the Chinese military's procurement platform, the US government concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon was "directly related to the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and was approved by the Chinese military as a supplier.

Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Mao Ning said at a press conference on Friday that regarding the accidental intrusion of a Chinese unmanned aerial vehicle into U.S. airspace due to force majeure, the Chinese side had repeatedly explained the situation and clarified its position.
She added that the US Congress's related resolutions were purely political manipulation and hype, according to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
China is strongly dissatisfied and firmly opposed to that.

Matthew Axelrod, Assistant Secretary for Export Enforcement at the U.S. Department of Commerce, said that today's action shows that our joint efforts to uncover and prevent China from using espionage balloons to violate the airspace of the United States and more than 40 countries have been successful.
Reuters reported that an employee of Guangzhou Tianhai Xingkong Technology Co., Ltd. said that he did not know about the sanctions and declined to make further comments.
The Chinese Embassy in the United States has not commented on these information.
