(Deutsche Welle Chinese) It has been several days since the earthquake hit parts of Turkey and Syria, and the hope of finding survivors is gradually fading, but the rescue of a family of five on Saturday brought great joy to the rescuers.
According to the Associated Press, the family of five was rescued after being trapped under the rubble for more than five days in Nurdağı, a town in the disaster-stricken Gaziantep province.
Rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from the rubble, followed by the father, but he insisted on saving his son and another daughter first.
When they were all rescued, the crowd cheered.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were also rescued from the rubble in the harsh cold weather.
"What day is it today?
"---The boy who was trapped under the rubble for 129 hours asked the rescue workers who pulled him out of the rubble.
A man from Kahramanmaras holds his cat, who was just rescued
The success of the rescue operation brought a glimmer of hope to the otherwise hopeless search, but the number of people trapped also continued to rise.
According to the official statistics, the earthquake on Monday has caused more than 20,000 deaths in Turkey and more than 3,500 deaths in neighboring Syria.
Although experts say that people can survive for more than a week after being trapped under rubble, the hope of finding more survivors is fading.
Rescue workers were still using thermal imaging cameras to search for signs of life beneath the rubble.
Meanwhile, the focus of the rescue work has started to shift to helping those who are in desperate need of assistance.
UN official: 'Once-in-a-century' disaster in region

Martin Griffiths, the UN under-secretary-general for humanitarian affairs and emergency relief coordinator, told a news conference in Turkey that the earthquake was the "worst disaster in the region in a century."
He also praised Turkey's "unusual" response to the disaster.
He also told Reuters that he hoped to provide aid to both government and opposition-held areas in Syria, but said that the situation was "not clear."
The UN has pledged an extra $25 million in aid to the Syrian earthquake-hit population.
Earlier this week, the UN announced it would give $25 million to Turkey and Syria for relief efforts.
The strongest earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
Chile earthquake (1960)
At 15:11 local time on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever recorded by human history occurred in Valdivia, Chile, with a seismic moment of 9.5.
In just ten minutes, Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
The earthquake was followed by a massive tsunami that hit the Chilean coast, with waves up to 25 meters high.
The tsunami reached as far as Japan and the Philippines.
The death toll and monetary losses arising from this widespread disaster are not certain.
The most devastating earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
Alaska earthquake (1964)
March 27, 1964 was a Friday, and also Good Friday.
On this day, the largest earthquake in the history of North America occurred in Alaska, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
Until 2006, the Alaska earthquake was still the third largest earthquake in the world since records began.
The earthquake occurred when a fracture between the Pacific Plate and the North American Plate broke near Prince William Sound, near College Fjord.
The earthquake lasted for three to five minutes in most areas.
The seabed displacement caused a huge tsunami with a height of 67 meters.
Because it was a holiday, schools and many businesses were closed.
The earthquake ultimately killed 139 people.
Nine people died directly from the earthquake, while 130 others died from the tsunami caused by the earthquake.
The strongest earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, Tangshan, Hebei Province, and Pingnan County, Shandong Province, China, were hit by two strong earthquakes of magnitude 7 or above within 16 hours.
The epicenter was 23 kilometers below the surface.
The traffic, communication, water supply and electricity in Tangshan were all cut off, and the city was leveled at once.
The capital city Beijing, 140 kilometers away, also felt strong tremors.
According to the official statistics, 242,769 people died and 164,851 people were seriously injured in all the affected areas including Beijing and Tianjin.
The Tangshan earthquake is the second deadliest earthquake in China's history, second only to the Shaanxi earthquake in 1556.
However, some foreign scientists estimate that the earthquake may cause at least 650,000 deaths.
The most devastating earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
Indian Ocean Earthquake (2004)

On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred in the western coast of Aceh Province, Sumatra Island, Indonesia, 160 kilometers away from the coast. The depth of the focus was 30 kilometers, and the moment magnitude was 9.1 to 9.3.
The earthquake triggered a massive tsunami with wave heights of up to 15 to 30 meters.

The Pacific coastline was affected by a total of 14 countries, and the areas with the most serious damage were Aceh Province in Indonesia, Phuket and tourist areas in Thailand, Sri Lanka and Tamil Nadu in India.

At that time, it was the peak tourist season of Christmas. The disaster-stricken areas gathered a large number of tourists and local residents, which led to many tourists who were enjoying their holidays on the beach and local people who were working on the coast being swept away by the tsunami, making this earthquake a missing person disaster.
The estimated number of deaths and missing persons is at least 300,000.
The most devastating earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
Sichuan earthquake (2008)
On May 12, 2008, a large earthquake occurred in Wenchuan, Sichuan Province, China.

According to the data of China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave magnitude of this earthquake reached 8.2, and the moment magnitude reached 8.3, and the area of destruction exceeded 100,000 square kilometers.

Up to September 25, 2008, the earthquake caused 69227 deaths, 17923 missing persons, 374643 injuries of different degrees, 1993.03 million people lost their homes, and the total population affected by the disaster was 4625.6 million.
It is the most destructive earthquake in the history of the People's Republic of China, and also the most serious casualty after the earthquake in Tangshan.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12 of each year would be designated as Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day, and that more attention would be paid to the education of the public and the work of disaster prevention and reduction.
After that, many governments and primary and secondary schools in China held earthquake drills on this day every year.
Primary and secondary schools have also begun to attach importance to popularizing "disaster reduction and earthquake preparedness" education.
The most devastating earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, a 7.0-magnitude earthquake occurred in the Caribbean Sea and the countries and islands in the region.
The epicenter of the earthquake was 25 kilometers to the southwest of Port-au-Prince, the capital of Haiti, and the hypocenter was about 13 kilometers below the ground.
The International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies estimated that as many as 3 million people had been affected by the quake.
The confirmed death toll released by the Haitian government exceeded 200,000.
Some areas in Haiti saw as much as 90% of their houses destroyed by the earthquake.
Although the international community has provided a lot of aid and support, this overpopulated, corrupt and poverty-stricken country has never recovered from this disaster.
The most devastating earthquake in the world in the past 60 years
Tōhoku earthquake and tsunami (2011)
On March 11, 2011, a megathrust earthquake with a moment magnitude of 9.0 occurred in the outer sea of the Tohoku region, Japan.

The earthquake occurred in the Pacific Ocean to the east of the capital city of Miyagi Prefecture, Sendai, with a focus depth of 24,000 meters, and triggered a tsunami with a maximum height of 40.1 meters.
This earthquake was the first earthquake in Japan with a magnitude greater than 9 recorded in history.
About 22,000 people died in the disaster, and about 40,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima Daiichi Nuclear Power Plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami, causing a leakage accident.
This accident was classified as the most serious level 7 on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
Radionuclides, including iodine-131 and caesium-137 (with a half-life of 30 years), were detected in minute quantities around the world after the Fukushima nuclear disaster.
Large amounts of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean as a result of the nuclear accident.
According to the United Nations, at least 870,000 people in the disaster areas of the two countries need food.
In Syria alone, more than 5.3 million people have lost their homes due to earthquakes.
The World Food Programme (WFP) has appealed for $77 million to provide food to people displaced by earthquakes in Turkey and Syria.
The temperature in the disaster area is now below zero, and many victims have no shelter.
The Turkish government has distributed large quantities of hot meals, tents and blankets, but these supplies are still difficult to reach many people in need.
In Syria, which has been mired in a conflict for 12 years, the earthquake has added to the misery of the population.
The World Food Programme has already provided food aid to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria in the four days since the earthquake.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for the treatment of external injuries and emergency surgery.

NEWS GOV-MO: Alert: Traffic Police Bureau Warns Citizens to Be on Guard Against Telecommunications Company Scam SMS

Recently, the traffic police received several cases of phone fraud. The criminals pretended to be the Australian Telecommunications Company and sent fraudulent messages containing website links to the victims, urging them to exchange their points for rewards as soon as possible, and then lured them to log into the fake website to exchange.

The victim entered the credit card information and verification code according to the instructions, and then received a notice from the financial institution that the credit card had an unauthorized transaction, suspecting that the credit card information was stolen by the above website.
It was confirmed that the relevant telecommunications company did not send the above SMS.

The Traffic Police Department calls on citizens to be vigilant if they receive similar SMS messages, and not to visit the website links in the SMS or provide any personal information; if they are asked to provide credit card information, account transaction passwords, or transaction verification codes, they should be extra cautious to prevent credit card theft.
Fraud prevention tips:
1. Pay more attention to the information of network security, and enhance personal prevention awareness;
Do not enter unknown websites and register personal and credit card information on the websites to prevent being used by others;
3. Be alert to fake websites and phishing websites, and pay attention to whether the website address is completely consistent with the official website;
4. Install anti-virus software on mobile phones, portable devices or computers, and update them regularly;
5. If you suspect that you have been deceived or have been involved in a crime, please call the Anti-Fraud Hotline 8800 7777 or the Reporting Hotline 993 for assistance.

Google AI chatbot "answers wrong questions" and parent company stock evaporates $100 billion
(Compiled on the 11th)

Google's newly launched artificial intelligence chatbot Bard was caught off guard, and in the promotional short video, it "answered the wrong question", causing the parent company Alphabet's stock to plummet by 8.9% on Tuesday, breaking the $100 barrier, and evaporating $110 billion (about 476.5 billion yuan) in market value, closing at $94.57 on Friday.
The market is worried that Alphabet will not be able to compete with its competitors, Microsoft.

According to Reuters, Google released the promotional video of AI chatbot Bard on social media earlier, and in the video, someone asked Bard: "What new discoveries about James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) can I tell my 9-year-old child?
"Bard mentioned in the answer that this telescope took the first photo of an exoplanet in the solar system.

However, according to the data of the US National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the first photo of exoplanets in the solar system was taken by the "Very Large Telescope" of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters also reported the news with the title of "Bard's wrong answer caused Alphabet's stock price to plummet".

On the other hand, Google pointed out that the response of Bard "highlights the importance of rigorous testing process", and it will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that the response of Bard "meets high standards in terms of quality, safety and truthful information".
Singapore's tourism industry recovers strongly, with inbound tourists increasing 19 times compared to 2021

(Compiled on 11th) The Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that the number of international tourists visiting Singapore in 2023 is expected to reach between 1.2 million and 1.4 million, which will bring in approximately SGD18 billion to SGD21 billion in tourism revenue; the number of tourists and tourism revenue will recover to approximately 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID-19 pandemic in
The Singapore tourism market gradually restarted and recovered in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board show that the number of inbound tourists in 2022 increased by 19 times from 330,600 in 2021 to 6.3 million, exceeding the earlier estimate of 400,000 to 600,000, and the number of tourists has already recovered to 33% of the pre-pandemic level.

From January to September 2022, the total tourism revenue of Singapore was 8.96 billion Singapore dollars, and it was expected that the total tourism revenue of Singapore in 2022 would reach 13.8 billion to 14.3 billion Singapore dollars, which was 6 to 7 times that of 18.9 billion Singapore dollars in 2021, and had already recovered to about 50% to
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced that it would allocate nearly S$50 million to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.
The SIT announced recently that it plans to allocate SGD 11 million from this budget in the next two years to promote more business and leisure activities to attract tourists back.

In order to make health and wellness a highlight of Singapore's tourism, the Singapore Tourism Board launched a consultation activity on November 23, 2022, to develop a health and wellness site on the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Liling, the executive director of the Sports and Wellness Tourism Division of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put their physical health at the top of their considerations.

Developing a healthy living site in Marina South, which is home to Gardens by the Bay and Marina Barrage, is expected to contribute to the tourism and economy of Singapore, and make tourists stay longer in Singapore for consumption and entertainment.
Chen Byong, the director of the Singapore Tourism Board, said that health and wellness will become an important part of Singapore's tourism products in the next few years.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised public awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Board has been promoting healthy living projects to the local population and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Health and Wellness Festival, providing more than 130 types of health activities and experiences for the public.
Singapore will continue to provide new travel experiences for tourists.

Besides the newly opened Singapore Children's Museum and Gardens by the Bay's Avatar World, Orchard Central Marketplace, and ArtScience Museum's new "Explore New Frontiers" gallery, as well as the open-air theatre at the Night Safari, the tourism board will support the development and updating of projects such as the Jurong Bird Park, to make Singapore an attractive international travel destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will establish industry standards related to meetings, incentive travel and exhibitions (MICE) and sustainable development of the tourism industry within 2023, and focus on improving the problems of waste disposal and carbon emissions in two aspects to further optimize the tourism environment.
The recovery of Singapore's tourism industry has accelerated the recovery of the aviation industry.

According to the data, as of December 18, 2022, Changi Airport has seen a strong recovery in passenger traffic, with daily passenger volume reaching 15,000 and weekly passenger volume reaching 100,000, which is equivalent to about 75% of the pre-pandemic level, and the number of airline employees has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-pandemic level.

According to the data, from January to October 2022, Singapore has received 23.6 million tourists, which is equivalent to 42% of the pre-pandemic period, and 1.7 million flights, which is equivalent to 53% of the pre-pandemic period.
The recovery of the tourism industry has also driven the recovery of accommodation, transportation, catering and shopping industries.
The Singapore government and the tourism industry have high hopes for the Chinese market.
According to the survey of a travel platform in China, the safety index of Singapore is ranked among the top three in the world, which is also one of the reasons why Chinese tourists love Singapore.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, about 3.6 million Chinese tourists traveled to Singapore for vacation each year.
With China relaxing its border policy, it is estimated that the number of Chinese tourists will recover to 30% to 60% of 2019 this year.
Koh Suk San pointed out that the next step, the Ministry of Tourism will closely monitor the signals of further release of China's outbound travel policies to meet the changing needs of tourists.

In addition to strengthening partnerships with Chinese online travel platforms and travel agencies, the Singapore Tourism Board will also actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists in response to the new trends in outbound tourism in China.

Looking forward to the 2023 tourism market, the Singapore Tourism Board is full of confidence, believing that as long as the global economy does not experience a significant decline in public income and there are no new large-scale deadly epidemics, the recovery of the tourism industry will be faster than expected.

Chongyang Q&A: How to view the US January non-agricultural employment data that exceeded expectations by a large margin and the future trend - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
A: As for the Chongyang investment, how do you view the U.S. January non-agricultural employment data that exceeded expectations and future trends?

A: On February 3, the U.S. Department of Labor released the employment data for January 2023. The number of non-agricultural employment increased by 517,000, which was much higher than the market expectation of 189,000. The unemployment rate fell to 3.4%, which was the lowest in nearly 50 years. The hourly wage increased by 4.4% year-on

From the perspective of the total, this data has many one-time and technical factors that affect it, such as the re-employment of striking teachers, the adjustment of the survey and statistical mouth, and the update of the seasonal adjustment factor. It may be corrected in the future (the new non-agricultural employment in January 2022 was revised from 504,000 to 364,000), and the

From the structural perspective, the impact of layoffs in high-tech enterprises is still there, but the proportion is relatively low; high-contact service industries such as leisure hotels, education and healthcare have seen a significant increase in new employment, and the data shows that the labor shortage in the service industry still exists.

Combined with the strong rebound of service industry PMI, job vacancies and labor shortages data that exceeded expectations, and the strong consumption credit data, we judge that the US service industry has undergone a rapid recovery after extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that the tight supply and demand situation in the US labor market is difficult to improve without a recession.

At present, the US labor market still has a supply gap of more than 5 million, and the labor force participation rate is rising slowly, especially the labor force participation rate of 25-54 years old is close to the high point before the epidemic.
In addition, due to the strong demand for excess savings and consumption credit of American residents, the strong demand will further delay the impact of tightening policies on the labor market.
The continuous tight labor market supply and demand will be the bottom line of the US economy in 2023.

Adding to this is the fact that the end of the current round of interest rate hikes is in sight, and inflation expectations are expected to continue to fluctuate. We are not optimistic about the continued decline in wage growth.
Before the release of the data, the US bond market was overly optimistic about the Federal Reserve's interest rate hike path.

With the continuous improvement of inflation data, the Fed, while shortening the pace of rate hikes, still maintains the fragile balance of market inflation expectations, but the market ignores the Fed's hawkish stance and expects to stop raising rates earlier and even cut twice at the end of the year.

In the context of a tight labor market and the uncertainty of the impact of tightening policies, we believe that the Fed's guidance to raise interest rates at the end of the year is relatively reasonable, and the extreme market expectations for adjustment and trading will be compressed or will have some impact on the market.

However, the persistent slowdown in inflation is likely to be a drag on wage growth, and the recent improvement in M2 and various CPI components suggests that U.S. CPI data has already entered a period of rapid decline, which will only serve as a floor for future inflation data. The current market expectations are difficult to verify, and the market may enter a new round of game after the next inflation data is released.

"Fund E-accounts" have arrived: Securities Regulatory Commission authorizes the development of a platform to enable investors to consolidate and inquire about all their funds - www.eeo.com.cn - Professional Financial News Website
Economic Observer Reporter Chen Xian: The complexity of the purchase channels of funds makes it difficult to collect account information?
Have you ever forgotten the "small vault"?
These problems of JIM will soon be solved.
On February 10, the CSRC announced that the “Fund E-account” APP was uploaded to various mobile app stores and conducted public trial operation.

According to the introduction, "Fund E-Account" provides a "one-stop" inquiry service for personal investors to obtain the account and share information of public funds, aiming to solve the pain points of the industry service that many small and medium investors forget their accounts and the inquiry is complicated.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were 156 public fund management companies in China, with a total fund size of approximately 2.6 trillion yuan; 167 registration institutions for public fund quotas, and 411 sales institutions for public funds.
Each registration agency account system is independent of each other, and there is no unified query channel in the industry.

Some industry insiders said that at the end of 2021, the number of fund investors in our country exceeded 720 million, which means that half of the population in the country invested in fund products.

Previously, investors had to query their purchase status through different sales channels, but with the “Fund E-Account”, they can query all purchase statuses through all sales channels, and their holdings of funds can be seen at a glance.
What is the "Fund E-Account" APP?

According to relevant documents, the "Fund E-Account" APP is a mobile application developed and constructed by China Clearing Co., Ltd. with the approval of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, which can provide investors with a one-stop query of the holding situation of fund products outside the market of public funds in the whole market.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp the holding situation of the fund products of all fund management companies under the flag of all funds purchased through all sales channels in the market through the "Fund E-Account", and comprehensively improve the efficiency of inquiry.

Specifically, the information that investors can query through the “Fund E-Account” includes the account information of the fund account opened by the fund management company of all public funds on the market, the account information of the trading account opened by the fund sales outlet, and the holding situation of the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the fund outside the

Liu Yiqian, the business manager of Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, told Economic Observer that investors can use the "Fund E-Account" APP to get a one-stop overview of their holdings of all off-exchange mutual funds, helping them recover "forgotten assets". More importantly, it helps investors to collect all the account information of their consolidated fund investment, so that they can better understand their investment situation, optimize their fund
How to register and use it?

The reporter noticed that the “Fund E-account” APP has been listed on Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, OPPO, vivo and other mobile application stores, but the APP is still in the public trial operation stage, and registration requires the input of the invitation code, which can be obtained by contacting the fund manager of the fund held by the investor.

A customer service staff member of a large or medium-sized public fund in Shanghai provided an Economic Observer reporter with a six-digit invitation code, and told the reporter, "The APP is still in the trial operation stage. China Settlement provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager, and investors can get them by calling the fund manager. We will provide them.
After the trial operation ends, users can register without invitation code.
The "Fund E-Account" App is currently in the trial operation stage, and investors can register by calling the fund management company and providing the invitation code.

The reporter registered the account and completed the query according to the relevant documents of the download and use instructions of the “Fund E-Account” published on the website of the China Securities Regulatory Commission. The whole process took only a few minutes, mainly including user registration, real name authentication, fund account binding, and public offering fund query.

After completing the real name authentication, by clicking the "asset" button for fund binding, all fund products purchased by the reporter through the sales platform of each fund will be presented in the binding options list (account binding), and the binding can be completed directly, and the total assets of the invested funds can be directly viewed, and the query function can be started.
It is worth noting that the “Fund E-account” only provides query services for investors, and cannot be redeemed or bought.
The data date displayed by "Fund E-Account" is generally three trading days before the date of the user's inquiry (T day).

For example, when opening the "Fund E-Account" on February 10, the total assets, fund shares and fund net asset value displayed on the asset page correspond to the date three trading days before that day, i.e., February 7.

The Federation of Trade Unions mobilizes a large-scale demonstration against the government's retirement reform plan again
On Saturday (February 11), the French trade union launched a national mobilization against the pension reform bill, calling on the public to take to the streets and express their opinions.
This is the fourth day of social actions against the government's pension system reform bill.
And how many people will respond to the rally call may influence the next action plan of the trade union.
This is the fourth time that the eight major French trade unions have jointly launched a nationwide mobilization in the past month, and the first time that the rally has been scheduled for Saturday.
Given that Saturday is a day off for most French people, who do not have to choose between joining a protest or a strike, the unions hope that the rally will attract more people.

No unions representing public transport, metro and state-owned railways called for strikes today, meaning public transport should be able to operate normally, allowing citizens to travel to the rally and people in regions where schools are closing for the winter holidays to travel to their destinations.
The unions hope for more than a million people to attend the rally, while police expect a national turnout of 600,000 to 800,000, with 90,000 to 120,000 in Paris.

Since the protest movement against the government's pension reform began, although polls show that most French people do not support the measure of delaying the retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people who really take to the streets to participate in the parade has gradually decreased.
The first strike and protest on January 31 attracted 1.27 million to 2.5 million people across the country.
The number of protesters on Monday (February 7) had shrunk to between 757,000 and 2 million across the country.
The pension reform is currently under discussion in the French National Assembly.
The opposition, particularly the leftist opposition, has submitted countless amendment proposals, slowing down the legislative process.
And the debate between the government and the opposition has become increasingly sharp.

A radical left-wing French party, La France Insoumise, has sparked controversy after one of its MPs posted a picture of himself on social media with a balloon bearing the face of the Labour Minister, which has been criticised by the ruling party.
The National Assembly Speaker finally announced a 15-day ban on the MP's participation in the Assembly activities as a punishment for this behavior.
Although this reform plan has triggered the largest social trend in France in the past 20 years, the government has only made some adjustments to the bill, but has not made any major concessions.

The unions are planning to launch another protest on Thursday, 16th, and they had also planned to organize a demonstration on March 7th when the reform bill was handed over to the Senate for discussion.

The last communist party leader of East Germany has passed away
The successor of the East German Communist Party reported in a statement that "last night, Hans Modrow, 95 years old, left us.
Therefore, our party has lost an important leader.
On November 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall was opened, separating East and West Berlin for 28 years, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democratic country.
At the time, the Communist leaders were forced to step down due to protests for democracy and freedom in various parts of East Germany.
Mikhail Gorbachev, who came to power in the Soviet Union, called for reforms in Eastern Europe, which was under Soviet control.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the German Democratic Republic.
The election results led to him no longer being chancellor.
Despite Gorbachev's reforms, opponents accused him of trying to delay the political changes and reunification that took place in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to reshape rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, he was found guilty of electoral fraud in the municipal elections of May 1989, but was not jailed.
The charges were said to be politically motivated.
He continued to serve in the German parliament from 1990 to 1994 and was a member of the European Parliament from 1999 to 2004.
Modrow saw himself as a reformer and wanted to change the party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters he did not want the old East Germany back, but said its achievements should be acknowledged.
Modrow was born in the German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica, Poland) in 1928 and trained as a mechanic.
During World War II, he was a leader of a youth fire brigade and became a member of the Nazi militia Volkssturm, which conscripted men aged 16 to 60 to fight in the final battles.
Captured by the Soviet army at the age of 17, he was taken to the Soviet Union as a prisoner of war and underwent a course of anti-fascist education, becoming a committed communist.
In 1949, the year East Germany was founded, he returned home and found a job as a mechanic, while continuing to study social sciences and economics and earning a doctorate.

Modrow was a worker in the Free German Youth Movement, almost all young East Germans joined, and he rose to head of the regional party of the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED) in Dresden from 1973 to 1989.
He served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany, taking on the highest state offices.
Iran marks revolution anniversary, hackers attack president's TV speech in support of protests

President Raisi's speech was interrupted several times by the chant "Death to America," a slogan at the state gathering.
The crowd also shouted "Death to Israel."

Reuters said that Adelkhah, who has been in prison since 2019, is one of the seven French nationals detained in Iran, and is one of the factors that have worsened relations between Paris and Tehran in recent months.

She was later placed under house arrest but was returned to prison in January.
Adelkhah denied the allegations.

Tighten restrictions on technology exports to China
The Wall Street Journal reported today that the US is preparing to further tighten its export of technology to China after the balloon incident.

The earthquake relief and rescue work in Turpan is ongoing day and night
Since the earthquake in Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have been working day and night in the rubble of thousands of destroyed buildings to rescue people buried under the rubble.
In the cold, they often call for quiet, because they are trying to hear any sign of life from the rubble of the old concrete.
Reuters reported today that two women were rescued from the rubble of the earthquake after several days.
But the death toll has risen to 24,150.
The death toll in Turkey was 20,665 and in Syria more than 3,500.

The 7.8 magnitude earthquake that struck on Monday has been followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, making it the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the death toll of Japan's 2011 earthquake and tsunami and approaching the 31,000 deaths caused by Iran's 2003 earthquake.
A similar strong earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 killed more than 17,000 people.

Two women were trapped for 122 hours after the deadliest earthquake in the region in the past 20 years hit Turkey on Saturday, and were rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building by Turkish rescue workers.
Another man, 55, was confirmed dead after being pulled from the rubble of a collapsed building in Diyarbakir, Turkey's southeastern largest city.
In the freezing cold, rescuers often call for calm as they strain to hear any sign of life from the rubble of the old concrete.
In the Samandag district of Turkey, rescuers knelt under a slab of concrete and whispered "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they carefully reached into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old baby.
He squinted his eyes and carried the baby Yagiz Ulas wrapped in a blanket to the field hospital.
Video footage showed rescuers also taking his mother, who was dazed and disoriented, with a pale face but clear consciousness, on a stretcher.
Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters overnight that 67 people had been rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours and 31,000 rescue workers were mobilized in the disaster area.
He said about 80,000 people were being treated in hospitals and 1.05 million were homeless, crammed into temporary shelters.
The leaders of both countries are facing growing criticism from the public for their response to the disaster, as many people are struggling to find food in the cold winter conditions.
Syrian state media said President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo, the first time he had visited the disaster zone since the earthquake.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said its stocks in rebel-held northwest Syria were running low because of the complexity of aid work in the war-torn country.
Erdogan visited Adiyaman province in Turkey on Friday and admitted that the government's response was not as quick as expected.
Opponents seized on the issue to attack Erdogan, who is seeking re-election in a May 14 vote that could be delayed by the disaster.
Anger over the delayed aid and rescue efforts could influence the election, Reuters said.
The vote was already seen as the toughest challenge to President Erdogan's rule in his 20-year tenure before the earthquake.
Erdogan called for unity and condemned what he called "negative movements" for political reasons.
The leader of Turkey's main opposition party, Kemal Kilicdaroglu, criticized the government's response.
Critics say "the earthquake is big, but what is worse is the lack of coordination, lack of planning and incompetence.

Among them, the Memorandum of Understanding on Green and Digital Economy Partnership and the Action Plan for Strengthening the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership between Vietnam and the Philippines in the 2023-2027 Period signed with the Philippines are the two highlights.
Vietnam and Singapore signed the Memorandum of Understanding on Green and Digital Economy Partnership.
Photo from Vietnam News Agency

During meetings with enterprise leaders, panel discussions, or attending economic forums, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh emphasized that Vietnam welcomes and creates favorable conditions for Singaporean and Malaysian enterprises to expand their investment in Vietnam in the areas of digital transformation, green energy, high technology, innovation and creativity, etc.

This visit not only helps deepen the cooperation relationship between Vietnam and Singapore and the Philippines in various traditional fields such as politics, diplomacy, economy, security, national defense, education and training, oil and gas, tourism, and people-to-people exchanges, but also creates a cooperation framework for the countries in new potential fields such as digital economy, green economy, energy transformation, innovation and creativity, and sustainable development.
King Hassanal Bolkiah of Brunei and Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh are preparing to enter the bilateral dialogue.
Photo from Vietnam News Agency
During his visit to the two countries, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also arranged time to visit and listen to the thoughts and wishes of the Vietnamese community living in the locality.

During the meeting between the leaders of the two countries, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh suggested that the governments of the two countries pay more attention to the Vietnamese community in the country, and create favorable conditions for them to contribute to the local society and cultivate the relationship between the two countries.
Both leaders agreed and supported the suggestion.

In particular, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh shared with the leaders of the two countries the desire for a united, peaceful, stable and prosperous ASEAN community; and agreed to maintain unity and cooperation with ASEAN countries and enhance the central role of ASEAN in the region and the international situation in the context of complex and changing regional and international situations.

With the important achievements obtained, Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh’s formal visit to Singapore and Malaysia is an effective implementation of the 13th National Congress of the Communist Party of Vietnam’s priority foreign policy line to strengthen relations with neighboring countries, effectively implement the Politburo’s conclusion No. 12 (12-KLW) on Vietnamese overseas work in the new situation, and also make positive contributions to mobilizing the strength
(End)
What is the "object" that fell from the sky in Alaska?
The guesses are all over the place.
The US military again used its most advanced stealth jet fighter F-22 to shoot down an unidentified object flying in the sky of Alaska on Saturday afternoon (February 10).
The object was shot down about 10 miles off the coast of Alaska.
This is the second time in less than a week that the U.S. military has shot down an unidentified object flying in the air.
A Chinese espionage balloon was shot down over the coast of South Carolina, near the U.S. state of South Carolina, after drifting in the U.S. airspace for several days last Saturday.

The Pentagon said the second object entered U.S. airspace for the first time on Thursday evening and was tracked by U.S. military as it moved through the airspace over eastern Alaska at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), about the size of a small car, much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier.
The Pentagon also said there was no evidence that the object was controllable.

John Kirby, the National Security Council's strategic communications coordinator, said Friday that while the specifics of the object flying in the sky were not clear, it "poses a reasonable threat to the safety of commercial aviation."
Kobbi said that this object was different from the espionage balloon found in the United States, and it did not have a "payload" hanging on it.
"We call it an 'object' because that's the best description we can make," he said.
President Biden consulted with the Pentagon before ordering the object to be shot down, and he made the decision "very carefully," Kobach added.
The official description of the object in the US can be summarized as: the size is similar to a small car, there is no control rod, no suspension, and the flying height is about 10,000 meters.
But those details still don't answer basic questions, such as what the object is, which country it belongs to, and what it is doing.
Many online analyses and speculations suggest that it may be another Chinese balloon.

It may be the same type of balloon that was used to invade U.S. airspace and the one that was floating over Latin America, both of which are from China and are performing some kind of task at different locations.
Some people have linked the "object" in Alaska with "unidentified flying objects" (UFO).
The report of Newsweek quoted the tweet of former US Congressman Peter Meijer on Friday, saying "I hope this 'unidentified flying object' is also a spy balloon, not a legal UFO".
"The idea of conflating alien spacecraft with weather balloons is a joke, but it's not worth causing an international incident over," Meijer said.
Meijer posted the tweet shortly after Kobe Bryant confirmed the object had fallen in Alaska.
Newsweek said Meijer was not the only one to doubt the object was a UFO.

Republican Rep. Tim Burchett of Tennessee criticized the government's handling of the information last month and called on the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to release a report on the "unidentified aerial phenomena."

I read it a long time ago, and I just happened to see the review, so I'll write my thoughts.
This book is not a collection of short stories, but rather a collection of fragments of love in life.
The tone of the book is very calm, like the calmness of boiled water, the words and sentences are simple and concise, and the plot is also like a quiet afternoon street in summer.
Each short story is a clip of a small moment in ordinary life, without a beginning or an end.
Finally, they were collected together and named "What We Talk About When We Talk About Love".

I think that this collection of short stories, and its title, is a kind of performance art, and the author wants to express that love is not just the tragic and happy splits on the stage, the dried up sea and the worn out stone in the urban legend, and it is not just the glue that sticks you and me together, and love is not just the above and should not be represented by the above, and love is also the quiet and peaceful life, the dull and tast
When you read this book, you may recall the quarrelsome couple beside you, the tasteless marriage of your acquaintances, and the unsatisfactory love.

This is why I don't recommend reading it, from the perspective of literary taste, the writing and plot are tasteless, unless your life is full of excitement and sweetness, like living in a candy castle, otherwise, you will feel that it is strange and boring when you read it.

And from a depth of thought, the daily incidents do not illuminate or expand the reader's mind and vision (unlike Marquez's "Love in the Time of Cholera"), and the brief segments do not discuss any issues, such as what kind of mistake led to the failure of love?
What were the reasons for the protagonist's marriage breakdown?
So I don't recommend reading this book, whether you read it or not doesn't matter much.
The author's ideas are more expressed through technique and tone than storyline, which is another reason why the reading experience is not great.
It is suitable for coarse reading, but not for fine reading.
The logic of the book is good, but the content is not rich enough.
It explains a lot about sales theory and why, but it is very weak on how to do it, just pointing the direction but not giving specific methods.
Also, the book felt like it was pieced together.
For example, there are both domestic and foreign ones; there are both famous entrepreneurs or salesmen and those who are not well known but have a good reputation.
It is not clear whether the stories are compiled for the sake of examples. If some cases that the author has experienced are cited, it would be more convincing.
The title of the customer is changing from customer to customer.
The title is still customers, but the content has changed to customers.
There are also problems with misspelled words, missing punctuation marks, and incorrect numbering in the e-book.
In general, this book is a good choice as a theoretical introduction, but it is not suitable for those who have already engaged in sales work and want to improve their sales level.
A Quick Guide to Understanding Internet Finance

This book is quite shallow, and can be said to be a beginner’s course, which can help people quickly understand the overall situation of Internet finance, but to understand it in depth, you still need to find a way to find it yourself and dig deeper.

It was published earlier, and the content about the later Alipay and WeChat supplementing and complementing each other to cultivate user habits is not mentioned, and the proportion of third-party payment today is probably much smaller than what is said in the book.
Nowadays, many people go out to eat with their mobile phones, and merchants also abandon UnionPay because of the high bank flow.

However, I would like to thank the author for writing this introductory book. It is obvious that the author has at least many years of financial observation experience, and is familiar with the development history of domestic and foreign finance, so he can write such easy-to-understand content.
It is easy to write high-level abstracts, but it is difficult to write in plain language.
I love you, and I want you to know it!
The first factor that determines a person's job satisfaction is not the salary, but whether he or she is recognized and valued in the work.

According to Maslow's hierarchy of needs, after people's basic survival needs are met, the most urgent thing is to meet their psychological needs - the desire to be understood, affirmed and recognized.
In fact, for the Chinese, most of them are "love you in the heart and throat is difficult to open", even if they love, thank and praise, they will keep it in their heart and will not say it out loud.
In this book, the author explains the five languages of praise: words of affirmation, quality time, acts of service, gifts, and physical touch.

I think the important thing is not that you know what the five languages of appreciation are, but that you can use them spontaneously and sincerely to appreciate, thank and praise the people around you, whether they are family members, friends or colleagues.
In fact, the closer the people around us are, the more they need praise and gratitude, and our lives will be more beautiful.
Learn to praise, and enterprises can also retain talents to a certain extent and reduce turnover rate.

My worst internet shopping experience
After placing an order on September 28, the system showed that the goods had been shipped, but I didn't receive the goods until October 12.
When I asked Amazon about the status of my order, the seller didn't provide the express number, so I couldn't find the order.
So I sent an email to the seller asking if they could provide the courier number, but they still haven't replied after two days.

In the end, I called Amazon's customer service, and the customer service told me the seller's mobile phone number. I called the store again, and after several calls, the phone was connected, and I was told that the package had been delivered, and I could immediately ask for a new one.
Although I was very angry, I didn't say much to the seller because the computer was very urgent, and I just wanted them to send it to me as soon as possible.
The result is that I called the next day and asked if it had been shipped?
The seller said it hadn't been sent yet, and it would be sent in the afternoon.
I called again in the afternoon and the seller said that it would be sent, and would be sent after 5 or 6 pm, but when I called at 7 pm in the evening, no one answered the phone.
I called again in the morning of the third day and asked if the goods had been sent out.
Can you tell me the order number?
The seller said it hadn't been sent, and told me to order it from another store if I was in a hurry, and it would be sent in the afternoon if I could wait.
I can't, I have to order from another store and it will take a long time.
All we can do is ask the seller to send it out as soon as possible.

The worst shopping experience in history

On the evening of September 23, my wife's mobile phone was dropped, and I suddenly bought a watch from Malaysia Amazon for 8p, which was delivered but not self-operated and without additional charges (I was secretly happy), because it was not self-operated, the delivery was slower, and the system showed that the latest delivery time was expected to be September 27.

My wife was without a phone and was suffering, so she called me at 6:30 the next morning to think of a way to get a phone, and then I saw that there was a 256G phone that could be delivered to Beijing the same day, so I had to order another one immediately.
I bought a new one, and I wanted to cancel the order from Amazon as soon as possible.

Because the order was placed at midnight, it was impossible to receive the courier in the morning, so I called the customer service at 7:30 to cancel the order, and the customer service said that the order had been cancelled and was waiting for the SMS notification.

OK, I will wait patiently. At noon, I checked my phone and found that the order was still in the status of not shipped. I immediately contacted the customer service to cancel the order as soon as possible. The customer service replied that the operation was successful.

At 3pm, I checked my phone and found that the order was still there. I couldn't do anything but call the customer service again to tell them that I had called them for the third time, and asked them to cancel the order and tell the seller not to send the goods!
The customer service contacted the seller at my request and informed me that the seller was not familiar with the system and would cancel the order after familiarizing himself with the system.
But they told me the seller knew, so don't worry, it won't be sent.
When I looked at the order on Monday, I found that it had been shipped, and I was speechless.
Because I couldn't contact the seller directly, I had to call the customer service again.
The following handling was speechless, basically I said one step, and the customer service operated it for a while.
The order is still in the state of delivery refusal, and is preparing to be sent again!
Amazon should not be passive, right?
The seller's company has received the money, so it doesn't matter if they don't follow up.
In summary, I will never pay in advance for large items again, this is too troublesome.
